name: Jayant Sethi
about: I am a highly motivated professional with a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering. With 4+ years of experience in IT industry, I've honed my skills as a System Engineer, contributing to the card payments domain with expertise in GoLang, database solutions, and agile teamwork. My internships encompass building chatbots, providing pro bono consulting, and leading large-scale projects. Beyond work, I've spearheaded technical initiatives, represented my college in competitions, and engaged in diverse volunteering efforts. My passion for sustainability, innovation, and creative problem-solving drives my personal and professional pursuits. Let's connect and explore collaborative opportunities!

experience.title: Field Researcher
experience.description: â€¢ Forum for Democracy aims to help and assist regional governments, political parties and public bodies in policy making through on-ground research and modern data analysis. It helped a national political party and a regional public office to get the on-ground insights from the beneficiaries of the policies. â€¢ As a Field Research Scholar, I have interacted with hundreds of citizens and gathered data to know about the civic issues that they face, documented it and analyzed it with simultaneously spreading awareness among citizens.

volunteer_experience.info:
WE MEAN TO CLEAN (WMTC) is a Delhi-NCR based volunteer group conducting spotfixes, cleanup drives, native tree plantation and waste management awareness programs in the region. WMTC volunteers are a team of highly motivated people from different walks of life - ranging from students to working professionals - who want to realize the dream of a clean Delhi and a clean India - Swachh Bharat. We believe that keeping our city and country clean is not only the responsibility of government alone butâ€¦
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          WE MEAN TO CLEAN (WMTC) is a Delhi-NCR based volunteer group conducting spotfixes, cleanup drives, native tree plantation and waste management awareness programs in the region. WMTC volunteers are a team of highly motivated people from different walks of life - ranging from students to working professionals - who want to realize the dream of a clean Delhi and a clean India - Swachh Bharat. We believe that keeping our city and country clean is not only the responsibility of government alone but that of citizens like us too! Hence, we engage in 'shramdaan' or donation of effort on a weekly/ fortnightly basis.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
